#summary Eclipse for use with PINF

PINF is developed using [http://www.eclipse.org/ eclipse] as the IDE, but you do not need to use eclipse to work with PINF (any editor will do). PINF is also aimed for use in Virtualized environments, specifically [http://aws.amazon.com/ Amazon Web Services] which provide [http://aws.amazon.com/eclipse/ tools for eclipse] to speed up your development.

= Typical Eclipse Setup - PHP Development Tools (PDT) =

  # Download *Eclipse PDT All-in-one* from: http://www.zend.com/en/community/pdt
  # Install Plugins (Menu: _Help_ -> _Install New Software..._, _Work with:_ -> _Add_):
    # *Web Tools Platform (WTP)*: http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/updates (Also install _Project Provided Components_)
    # *Data Tools Platform (DTP)*: http://download.eclipse.org/datatools/updates
    # *AWS Toolkit for Eclipse*: http://aws.amazon.com/eclipse
    # *Subversive*: http://download.eclipse.org/technology/subversive/0.7/update-site
      * *Connector: Native JavaHL*: http://community.polarion.com/projects/subversive/download/eclipse/2.0/update-site
